column4: I were told to install Ubuntu to one of the school's computers and I did, installed the whole system over the Net. However, now that Desktop is installed, the connection doesn't function at all, doesn't get the IP although it did during installation.
Sometimes proxy detection is flaky or turned off
What should I do ?
Check the proxy settings ;P
System -> Preferences -> Network Preferences
Network Proxy* rather
click Automatic then close it and reboot, hopefully
The funny thing, looking at an WinXP machine next to it, there is no proxy settings used in Internet Explorer's.
Not even automatically detect proxy settings?
Not even automatic selected.
I'm just making assumptions based on how schools usually have internet access set up :)
In that case, that isn't your issue and you should disregard my terrible advice, rautamiekka. =]
No problem. Just a moment.
I don't have any ideas, so I'll pass you back to the channel and get back to what I was doing
Thank you ! That fixed it :)
...Seriously?
Seriously.
Hey, whatever works. I'm glad it did. :)
Me too.
This means that the installer was auto-using proxy auto-detection.
That's what I figured. The live system and the installer are slightly different, as are those two and the final installation.
One new thing learnt.
Usually they all act the same but oddities between them can point to things like your solution :)
